page.title: 19LAW AND ORDER IN RAMSBOTTOM
page.content: P.C. Storey joined the{police force}11 years ago and has worked in Ramsbottom for 4 years. For the past year he has been Area Constable responsible for 15500 people and almost 5000 hectares of land. Ramsbottom has 2 area constables, a C.I.D. officer, car patrols, dog vans and an area traffic car. There are police horses at Bury and Task Force and{patrol cars}come into the area from neighbouring Lancashire. Many policemen live in Ramsbottom and because it is such a{close-knit } {community}less crime is committed and about 90% of that that is committed is solved. Most of the 850{crimes } committed in 1984 were burglaries. There has been an increase in the number of muggings and thefts from houses and there is concern about bogus officials gaining access.
